definition: to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk

sentences.english: This movie tersely portrays the characters' personalities.
sentences.chinese: 影片洗練地刻畫了人物的性格。

sentences.english: The author's laconic prose manages to be both dexterous and sinister.
sentences.chinese: 這位作者簡潔的文字做到既洗練又有邪惡的暗示。

sentences.english: His style was chastened by study of great writers.
sentences.chinese: 他的文筆因研究了偉大作家的作品而變得洗練。

sentences.english: His witty , profound , terse writing style makes his literary works are with high artistic value.
sentences.chinese: 他的作品文筆俏皮，精深洗練，具有很高的藝術價值。

definition: music/rhyme and rhythm/initial, 音[yin1], and final and tone, 韻|韵[yun4], of a Chinese character/phoneme
to blend into one another/to blend together well
a transition (stop and change) in spoken sound, music or in brush strokes/a cadence/punctuated by a transition/with syncopated cadence (brush stroke in painting)
lucid and elegant/quiet and exquisite/clear and attractive style
